name: Blank Diamond Sign
tooltip: There's a search bar at the bottom
note: Click a sign in the array to select it. Use the search bar if you want a specific sign.

name: Left Added Lane
tooltip: Don't use if the added lane ends soon after
note: Don't use this sign if the added lane ends soon after the merge (unless the lane gets dropped).

name: Right Added Lane
tooltip: Don't use if the added lane ends soon after
note: Don't use this sign if the added lane ends soon after the merge (unless the lane gets dropped).

name: Right-Turning 270-Degree Loop (Net Turn Left)
tooltip: The loop should be roughly 235 degrees or more
note: The loop doesn't have to be exactly 270 degrees. A turn of at least 235 degrees justifies this sign.

name: Left-Turning 270-Degree Loop (Net Turn Right)
tooltip: The loop should be roughly 235 degrees or more
note: The loop doesn't have to be exactly 270 degrees. A turn of at least 235 degrees justifies this sign.

name: Entering Roadway, Added Lane on Right
Entering Roadway, Added Lane on Left

note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: General Wild Animals/Deer
tooltip: Handy for mods with deer
note: Can find more utility if you have a mod with deer.

name: Farm Equipment
tooltip: Handy for mods with farm vehicles
note: Can find more utility if you have a mod with farm vehicles.

name: Roll-Over Hazard
tooltip: Handy if vehicles can overturn. Use on sharp turns
note: Can find more utility if vehicles from your mod can roll over. Advised to be used with sharp turns.

name: Light Rail Crossing
tooltip: A light rail is basically a railroad for trams.

name: DRAWBRIDGE
tooltip: Drawbridges need not look like drawbridges!
note: Some forms of English consider ANY opening bridge as a drawbridge.

name: Kangaroos
tooltip: Handy for mods with kangaroos
note: Can find more utility if you have a mod with kangaroos.

name: Bears
tooltip: Handy for mods with bears or in biomes that spawn polar bears
note: Can find more utility if you have a mod with bears or use this in an area with polar bears.

name: Bears (with cub)
tooltip: Handy for mods with bears or in biomes that spawn polar bears
note: Can find more utility if you have a mod with bears or use this in an area with polar bears.

name: Snowmobiles
tooltip: Handy for mods with snowmobiles
note: Can find more utility if you have a mod with snowmobiles.

name: General Enemies/Creepers
tooltip: Use near enemy-prone areas
note: Recommended near mob spawners and other areas that are prone to enemies or ambushes.

name: Skeletons
tooltip: Use near skeleton-prone areas
note: Recommended near skeleton spawners, cliffs that skeletons can shoot players off of, and other areas that are prone to skeletons or skeleton ambushes.

name: Zombies
tooltip: Use near zombie-prone areas
note: Recommended near zombie spawners, villages (since zombie raids can start during the night regardless of light level), and other areas that are prone to zombies or zombie ambushes.

name: ZOMBIES
tooltip: Use near zombie-prone areas
note: Recommended near zombie spawners, villages (since zombie raids can start during the night regardless of light level), and other areas that are prone to zombies or zombie ambushes.

name: Spiders
tooltip: Use near spider-prone areas
note: Recommended near spider spawners, cobweb-covered areas (since spiders aren't slowed down by them), walls that have no lip (since spiders can climb over), and other areas that are prone to spiders or spider ambushes.

name: Endermen
tooltip: Use near enderman-prone areas or on roads made of blocks endermen can take
note: Recommended in very open areas (since players might provoke endermen by looking at them), places with frequent sight obstructions (since endermen might hide behind one of these), the End, and other areas prone to endermen or enderman ambushes, as well as on roads (or parts of roads) made of blocks that endermen can take.

name: Ghasts
tooltip: Use near ghast-prone areas or on roads that ghasts can destroy
note: This sign is fit for the Nether. Recommended in very open areas, near lava pools (since ghasts can hide in them), and in other areas that are prone to ghasts or ghast ambushes, as well as on roads made of blocks that ghasts can destroy.

name: Slimes/Magma Cubes
tooltip: Use near slime- or magma cube-prone areas
note: Recommended in swamps, in areas with slopes (since slimes and magma cubes can climb slopes rather quickly), near where players have reported slime sightings, near cliffs in the Nether (since magma cubes don't take fall damage), and in other areas prone to slimes or magma cubes or slime or magma cube ambushes.

name: Pedestrian Crossing
tooltip: Place at the location of the pedestrian crossing

name: FRESH OIL
tooltip: Handy for mods that add spillable oil
note: Can find utility if you have a mod that adds spillable, slippery oil.

name: Entering Roadway, Added Lane on Right (Construction)
Entering Roadway, Added Lane on Left (Construction)
Blank Miscellaneous Sign
tooltip: There's a search bar at the bottom
note: Click a sign in the array to select it. Use the search bar if you want a specific sign.

name: Japanese Stop Sign
tooltip: This isn't a yield sign.

name: Right Arrow Plaque
tooltip: Should be used with route markers to show direction.

name: Left Arrow Plaque
tooltip: Should be used with route markers to show direction.

name: Left-Right Arrow Plaque
tooltip: Should be used with route markers to show direction.

name: Up Arrow Plaque
tooltip: Should be used with route markers to show direction.

name: Down Arrow Plaque
tooltip: Should be used with route markers to show direction.

name: Up-Left Arrow Plaque
tooltip: Should be used with route markers to show direction.

name: Up-Right Arrow Plaque
tooltip: Should be used with route markers to show direction.

name: KM/H Plaque
tooltip: Use under a rectangular Speed Limit sign for KM/H speeds
note: Use with a rectangular Speed Limit sign to indicate that it is for kilometers per hour instead of miles per hour.

name: 'GIVE WAY' Plaque
tooltip: In other words, yield.

name: Snowflake Plaque
tooltip: For icy conditions or biomes
note: Use under a Slippery When Wet sign to indicate that it is because of ice or applies during icy conditions.

name: 'CEDEZ LE PASSAGE' Plaque
tooltip: French for 'Yield'

name: 'EXEMPT' Sign
tooltip: Use to indicate that a railroad crossing is considered exempt

name: 'NORTH' Plaque
tooltip: Use to show the general direction of the route.
note: Should be used with route markers to show cardinal direction. The exact direction of the road needs not be north, but the route should go in that general direction.

name: 'SOUTH' Plaque
tooltip: Use to show the general direction of the route.
note: Should be used with route markers to show cardinal direction. The exact direction of the road needs not be south, but the route should go in that general direction.

name: 'EAST' Plaque
tooltip: Use to show the general direction of the route.
note: Should be used with route markers to show cardinal direction. The exact direction of the road needs not be east, but the route should go in that general direction.

name: 'WEST' Plaque
tooltip: Use to show the general direction of the route.
note: Should be used with route markers to show cardinal direction. The exact direction of the road needs not be west, but the route should go in that general direction.

name: 'TO' Plaque
tooltip: Show the way to the route.

name: 'JCT' Plaque
tooltip: Junction with this route.

name: 'DETOUR' Plaque
tooltip: Show the temporary alternative route.

name: 'BUS' Plaque
tooltip: Show a business route.

name: Crossbuck (Vienna Convention White w/ Red Border)
Crossbuck (Vienna Convention Yellow w/ Red Border)
Crossbuck (America)
tooltip: Use the Crossbuck items instead; they're higher quality
note: You should use the Crossbuck items instead, since it is higher quality.

name: NO PASSING ZONE
tooltip: Place on the opposite shoulder of traffic if a passing zone ends on a two-way road
note: Should be used at the start of a no passing zone on a two-way road. Place on the opposite shoulder of traffic. (In the US this would be on the left side.)

name: NO ADELANTAR
tooltip: Place on the opposite shoulder of traffic if a passing zone ends on a two-way road
note: Should be used at the start of a no passing zone on a two-way road. Place on the opposite shoulder of traffic. (In the US this would be on the left side.)

name: ZONA DE NO PASAR
tooltip: Place on the opposite shoulder of traffic if a passing zone ends on a two-way road
note: Should be used at the start of a no passing zone on a two-way road. Place on the opposite shoulder of traffic. (In the US this would be on the left side.)

name: Countdown (Left, 1, Red on White)
tooltip: Place on left in decreasing order with equal spacing
note: Place to the left of the roadway, in decreasing order and with equal spacing and identical coloration.

tooltip: Place on left in decreasing order with equal spacing
note: Place to the left of the roadway, in decreasing order and with equal spacing and identical coloration.

name: Left-Right Arrow (Warning)
tooltip: At a T-intersection, place on opposite side to ending road
note: At a T-intersection, place on the side opposite to the terminating road, facing the terminating road.

note: Place at a largely sharp left curve, facing traffic and largely straight ahead.

name: Right Arrow (Warning)

note: Place at a largely sharp right curve, facing traffic and largely straight ahead.

name: Central Turn Lane
tooltip: Use on a two-way road that has a central turn lane
note: This should be used in roads with central turn lanes. The middle lane functions as a left turn lane for traffic coming in both directions. Use of the central turn lane to pass a vehicle is prohibited.

name: DO NOT PASS
tooltip: Should be used if passing is absolutely prohibited.

name: PASS WITH CARE
tooltip: Should be used if passing is no longer absolutely prohibited.

name: 'KEEP RIGHT' With Upwards Facing Right Arrow
'KEEP LEFT' With Upwards Facing Left Arrow
STAY IN LANE
tooltip: Should be used if passing is prohibited.

name: 'NO PARK' With Crossed Out P Symbol
'NO PARK ANYTIME' With Left And Right Arrow
'NO TURN ON RED' Ball
tooltip: Prohibit 'on-side' turns if they'd be otherwise allowed
note: This should be used to prohibit a right turn on a red traffic light when state/country laws would otherwise allow for this.

name: 30 Speed Zone
tooltip: Often in KM/H, but is MPH in the UK
note: Most areas consider this speed limit in kilometers per hour, but the United Kingdom uses it for miles per hour.

name: End 30 Speed Zone
tooltip: Often in KM/H, but is MPH in the UK
note: Most areas consider this speed limit in kilometers per hour, but the United Kingdom uses it for miles per hour.

name: Chevron Right Arrow (Black on Yellow)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals along a right curve
note: This should be used in multiples alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Chevron Left Arrow (Black on Yellow)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals along a left curve
note: This should be used in multiples alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Chevron Right Arrow (Red on White)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals along a right curve
note: This should be used in multiples  alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Chevron Left Arrow (Red on White)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals along a left curve
note: This should be used in multiples  alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Chevron Pattern Left (Yellow And Black)
tooltip: Place to left of road to mark obstacles
note: This should be used to direct drivers away from dangerous obstacles on the sides of a road.

name: Chevron Pattern Right (Yellow And Black)
tooltip: Place to right of road to mark obstacles
note: This should be used to direct drivers away from dangerous obstacles on the sides of a road.

name: Fuel
tooltip: Handy with vehicle mods that require fuel
note: Can find utility if the vehicles provided by your mod need fuel.

name: Repairs
tooltip: Handy with mod vehicles that can be repaired
note: Can find utility if the vehicles provided by your mod can be repaired.

name: Water
tooltip: Handy with mods that require players to drink water
note: Can find utility if you have a mod that requires players to drink water, such as Tough As Nails.

name: Fire Extinguisher
tooltip: Handy if a mod adds a fire extinguisher
note: Can find utility if you have a mod that adds a fire extinguisher. If not, a water bucket can suffice.

name: ONCOMING TRAFFIC MAY HAVE EXTENDED GREEN
Blank Square Sign
tooltip: There's a search bar at the bottom
note: Click a sign in the array to select it. Use the search bar if you want a specific sign.

name: Do Not Enter
tooltip: Not just for one-way roads
note: Don't limit this sign to just one-way roads. A restricted road can give this sign utility.

name: No Semi Trucks
tooltip: Good for roads not built for semis
note: Can find utility if the road is not suited for semis due to steep slopes, very tight turns, low clearances...

name: National Network Route
tooltip: The National Network is a system of recommended roads for large trucks.

name: Speed Bump
tooltip: Place at the location of the speed bump

name: Pedestrian Crossing
tooltip: Place at the location of the pedestrian crossing

name: You Have Priority Over Oncoming Traffic
Main Traffic Heading Left, Bus Lane Heading Right
Main Traffic Heading Right, Bus Lane Heading Left
Main Traffic Heading Left, Bike Lane Heading Right
Main Traffic Heading Right, Bike Lane Heading Left
Straight or Jughandle Right to Left Lane
Straight or Jughandle Left To Right Lane
Turn Right on the Left Lane
Turn Left on the Right Lane
Left Curve, Escape Lane to Right
Right Curve, Escape Lane to Left
MC Route 1
note: This is an example route shield. More route shields will come in future updates.

name: Chevron Arrow (Yellow on Black, Right)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals outside of sharp curves
note: This should be used in multiples alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Chevron Arrow (Yellow on Black, Left)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals outside of sharp curves
note: This should be used in multiples alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Main Road Turns Left at Intersection
Main Road from Ahead Turns to Left
Main Road from Ahead Turns to Right
Main Road Turns Right At Intersection
Main Road Takes Slight Right At Intersection
Main Road Takes Slight Left At Intersection
Main Road S-Curves Right, Side Road on Right
Main Road S-Curves Left, Side Road on Left
Chevron Arrow (Black on Yellow, Left)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals outside of sharp curves
note: This should be used in multiples  alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Chevron Arrow (Black on Yellow, Right)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals outside of sharp curves
note: This should be used in multiples  alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: LEFT TURN SIGNAL
tooltip: Place next to a traffic light that denotes left turns

name: LEFT TURN YIELD ON FLASHING YELLOW ARROW
'LEFT TURN YIELD ON FLASHING YELLOW' Arrow
'LEFT TURN YIELD ON FLASHING' Yellow Arrow
RIGHT ON RED ARROW AFTER STOP
RIGHT TURN SIGNAL
tooltip: Place next to a traffic light that denotes right turns

name: 'SIDEWALK CLOSED AHEAD, CROSS HERE' to Left
'SIDEWALK CLOSED AHEAD, CROSS HERE' to Right
'SIDEWALK CLOSED, USE OTHER SIDE' to Either Side
'SIDEWALK CLOSED, USE OTHER SIDE' to Left
'SIDEWALK CLOSED, USE OTHER SIDE' to Right
WRONG WAY
tooltip: Place facing away from normal traffic on a one-way street

name: Exit (Left) with Number Space
tooltip: You'll be able to edit this sign to add a number in a future update.

name: Exit (Right) with Number Space
tooltip: You'll be able to edit this sign to add a number in a future update.

name: Blank Triangle Sign
tooltip: There's a search bar at the bottom
note: Click a sign in the array to select it. Use the search bar if you want a specific sign.

name: Light Rail Crossing
tooltip: A light rail is basically a railroad for trams.

name: High Winds
tooltip: Handy for mods with wind
note: Can find utility if you have a mod that adds interactive wind.

name: Snow and/or Ice
tooltip: This sign is fit for snowy biomes.

name: Light Rail Crossing
tooltip: A light rail is basically a railroad for trams.

name: High Winds
tooltip: Handy for mods with wind
note: Can find utility if you have a mod that adds interactive wind.

name: Snow and/or Ice
tooltip: This sign is fit for snowy biomes.

name: Right-Turning 270-Degree Loop (Net Turn Left, Construction)
tooltip: The loop should be roughly 235 degrees or more
note: The loop doesn't have to be exactly 270 degrees. A turn of at least 235 degrees justifies this sign.

name: Left-Turning 270-Degree Loop (Net Turn Right, Construction)
tooltip: The loop should be roughly 235 degrees or more
note: The loop doesn't have to be exactly 270 degrees. A turn of at least 235 degrees justifies this sign.

name: Cross-Roads, Railroad to Right (Construction)
tooltip: Place 30 blocks from the crossing for a road, or 15 for pedestrian paths
note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: Cross-Roads, Railroad to Left (Construction)
tooltip: Place 30 blocks from the crossing for a road, or 15 for pedestrian paths
note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: Right Side Road Crosses Railroad (Construction)
tooltip: Place 30 blocks from the crossing for a road, or 15 for pedestrian paths
note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: Left Side Road Crosses Railroad (Construction)
tooltip: Place 30 blocks from the crossing for a road, or 15 for pedestrian paths
note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: T-Intersection, Railroad to Right (Construction)
tooltip: Place 30 blocks from the crossing for a road, or 15 for pedestrian paths
note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: T-Intersection, Railroad to Left (Construction)
tooltip: Place 30 blocks from the crossing for a road, or 15 for pedestrian paths
note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: T-Intersection After Railroad (Construction)
tooltip: Place 30 blocks from the crossing for a road, or 15 for pedestrian paths
note: The MUTCD says this sign should be 100 feet (30 blocks) from the RXR (50 [15 blocks] for pedestrian paths), displayed everywhere it can be.

name: Roll-Over Hazard (Construction)
tooltip: Handy if vehicles can overturn. Use on sharp turns
note: Can find more utility if vehicles from your mod can roll over. Advised to be used with sharp turns.

name: Pedestrian Crossing (Lime)
tooltip: Place at the location of the pedestrian crossing

name: EMERGENCY SCENE AHEAD
tooltip: For general emergency scenes

name: Bomb Scene Ahead
tooltip: For scenes where there is a known or exploded bomb

name: Possible Bomb Scene Ahead
tooltip: For scenes where a bomb is suspected or a threat to use one was made

name: Fire Scene Ahead
tooltip: For any fire, whether unintended, arson, or natural

name: INV CHECK AHEAD
tooltip: "Inventory Check Ahead"

name: Have Food?
tooltip: Use this somewhere that a player won't be able to get food for a long stretch

name: Ice
tooltip: This sign is fit for the snow.

name: LAG
tooltip: Use near areas prone to lag spikes

name: CHUNKS MAY BE INVISIBLE OR GLITCHED
tooltip: Use near areas prone to frequent chunk errors

name: KEEP AWAY FROM INVISIBLE CHUNKS
tooltip: Use near areas with hazardous blocks (lava, cacti, magma blocks) that chunk errors could hide

name: Left-Right Arrow (Construction Warning)
tooltip: At a T-intersection, place on opposite side to ending road
note: At a T-intersection, place on the side opposite to the terminating road, facing the terminating road.

name: Left Arrow (Construction Warning)
tooltip: Place at a largely sharp left curve
note: Place at a largely sharp left curve, facing traffic and largely straight ahead.

name: Right Arrow (Construction Warning)
tooltip: Place at a largely sharp right curve
note: Place at a largely sharp right curve, facing traffic and largely straight ahead.

name: Chevron Arrow (Black on Orange, Left)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals outside of sharp curves
note: This should be used in multiples  alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.

name: Chevron Arrow (Black on Orange, Right)
tooltip: Place at regular intervals outside of sharp curves
note: This should be used in multiples  alongside the outside edge of sharp curves.
